pageContext.description:
[The panel depicts] the Virgin and the infant Christ, who she holds on her left side. He has turned towards the infant St John, standing beside him and takes the scroll he offers with his left hand. Behind the Virgin there is an arbour with orange trees. At the far left and upper right there is a view of a mountainous landscape.
 [Ostpreußisches Landesmuseum, revised 2019]

[Ostpreußisches Landesmuseum, revised 2019]

pageContext.provenance:
- c. 1910 private collection, Dr. Freiherr Fr. W. von Bissing, München

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
- in good condition considering its age 
- the panel has been thinned (12 mm thick) and cradled (11 members with six moveable members) 
- thin paint layers with a fine, porcelain craquelé 
- some fills and retouches

pageContext.signature: Artist's insignia lower right corner: 'HK' beneath crown and ring

titles.title: The Virgin and Child with the Infant St John
